displayManager

Class SecondsTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • displayManager.SecondsTimer

  • public class SecondsTimer
extends java.lang.Object
    Simple class used for a timer that updates a JLabel every second.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private javax.swing.Timer myTimer
      The timer that will be incrementing that label.
      (package private) int time
      The intial time is 0 seconds.
      private javax.swing.JLabel timerLabel
      The label we will be using in our gameboard

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SecondsTimer(int xPos, int yPos, java.lang.String textString)
      The constructor initializes the label to the desired x and y position And to start with the text "Seconds Passed: 0"

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javax.swing.JLabel getLabel()
      A getter method for the label
      void resetTimer()
      A method to reset the timer to 0 and start again
      void startTimer()
      A method to start the timer with a delay of 1000 miliseconds (1 seconD)
      void stopTimer()
      A method to stop the timer.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • SecondsTimer

        public SecondsTimer(int xPos,
                    int yPos,
                    java.lang.String textString)
        The constructor initializes the label to the desired x and y position And to start with the text "Seconds Passed: 0"
        Parameters:
        xPos - the x pixel coordinate of the timer label location
        yPos - the y pixel coordinate of the timer label location
        textString - the string used to update the label
